snippet: Reactions to statements by Rachel A. Dolezal, the former president of the Spokane, Wash., N.A.A.C.P. chapter and a university instructor in African-American studies, who has claimed for years that her heritage is partly black — a claim her parents...
lead_paragraph: Reactions to statements by Rachel A. Dolezal, the former president of the Spokane, Wash., N.A.A.C.P. chapter and a university instructor in African-American studies, who has claimed for years that her heritage is partly black — a claim her parents say is a lie.

headline.main: Other Viewpoints on the Link Between Race and Identity

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
